business.start.para: Mr. Speaker (Hon. Sir Littleton Groom)took the chair at 3 p.m., and read prayers.

talker.role: Prime Minister and Minister for External Affairs
talker.name: BRUCE, Stanley
Mr BRUCE

talk.start.para: . - (By leave.) -Last night, subsequent to, and in consequence of, thevote that was taken in committee on the Maritime Industries Bill, I stated that the Government desired time to consider its position, and moved the adjournment of the House.

speech.para: The Government, having considered its position, I, this morning, had an interview with His Excellency the Governor-General, at which I tendered to him certain advice. His Excellency is now considering that advice; consequently, there is no further statement which I can make at the. moment. I, therefore, move -

quote.para: That the House do now adjourn.
